10847Journal of inclusion phenomena and macrocyclic chemistryJournal of Inclusion Phenomena0923-07501573-1111Kluwer Academic PublishersDordrechtArt13515078210.1023/B:JIPH.0000011777.69684.f1ArticleComplexation Studies of a Calix[4](aza)crown and Crystal Structure of its Magnesium ComplexOueslatiIssam1AbidiRym1ThuéryPierre2VicensJacques3Facultés des Sciences de Bizerte7021ZarzounaTunisieLaboratoire de Chimie des Interactions Moléculaires Spécifiques, (CNRS UMR 7512)Chimie Polymères Matériaux25 rue BecquerelF-67087StrasbourgFrancegrid.457334.2CEA/Saclay, DSM/DRECAM/SCM (CNRS URA 331)Bât. 125F-91191Gif-sur-YvetteFrance122003473-41731785102004© Kluwer Academic Publishers 20032003Abstract

A systematic study of extraction properties and complexation behaviour of the calix[4](aza)crown 1 towards alkaline earth (Mg2+, Ca2+,Sr2+, Ba2+) and transition metal (Co2+, Ni2+, Cu2+,Zn2+) cations is presented. The binding behaviour of 1 was also investigated by 1H-NMR and the crystal structure of the 1:1 complex with Mg2+ isdescribed.

elements.content: A systematic study of extraction properties and complexation behaviour of the calix[4](aza)crown 1 towards alkaline earth (Mg2+, Ca2+,Sr2+, Ba2+) and transition metal (Co2+, Ni2+, Cu2+,Zn2+) cations is presented. The binding behaviour of 1 was also investigated by 1H-NMR and the crystal structure of the 1:1 complex with Mg2+ isdescribed.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

A systematic study of extraction properties and complexation behaviour of the calix[4](aza)crown 1 towards alkaline earth (Mg2+, Ca2+,Sr2+, Ba2+) and transition metal (Co2+, Ni2+, Cu2+,Zn2+) cations is presented. The binding behaviour of 1 was also investigated by 1H-NMR and the crystal structure of the 1:1 complex with Mg2+ isdescribed.
